headline.main: The Story of the British Today -- Written by Themselves; A Remarkable Collection of Letters Written by All Classes That Gives a Vivid and Coherent Picture of the Nation at War WAR LETTERS FROM BRITAIN. Edited by Diana Forbes-Robertson and Roger W. Straus Jr. With foreword by Vincent Sheean. 240 pp. Published in cooperation with Current History and Forum. New York: G.P. Putnam's Sons. $2.

lead_paragraph: AN old lady in Oxford Street explained one morning that she had not heard the air-raid sirens. "But when I saw the people running and laughing I knew that it must be an alarm." And the English-woman whose letter notes that characteristic episode comments with equally characteristic restraint on the general reaction to the bombing of Britain, "I think Hitler would be dissatisfied."
